repnme.cdata!:
Armenia - Second Judicial Reform Project :
            redacted report

abstracts.cdata!:
The Judicial Reform Project was designed
            to provide Armenia's judiciary with the administration,
            facilities, and expanded capacity necessary to improve the
            efficiency, reliability, and transparency of judicial
            operations and services. The purpose of the investigation
            underlying this report is to allow the World Bank Group
            (WBG) to determine if the rules have been violated. This
            report summarizes the findings of an administrative inquiry
            (the investigation) by the WBG's Integrity Vice
            Presidency (INT) into allegations of irregularities in a
            joint venture bid submitted by Company A for a contract
            under the Bank-financed Armenian project. The investigation
            involved Company A and a Company A representative. INT
            investigated allegations that Company A, under the
            supervision of such representative, submitted a bank
            reference letter containing false information in the bid for
            a contract under the project. INT's interviews with
            relevant parties and review of correspondence between
            Company A's joint venture partner, Company B, and the
            Issuing Bank indicate that Company B was not aware that the
            bank reference letter was false. The WBG reserves the right
            to invoke its privileges and immunities, including at any
            time during the course of an investigation or a subsequent
            judicial or other proceeding pursued in connection with this matter.

19781666.trustfund:
TF057514-PHRD: ARMENIA: JUDICIAL REFORM
            PROJECT 2,TF091251-ARMENIA DUTCH CO-TF FOR
            JUDICIAL REFORM PROJECT 2

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Judicial Reform Project for
            Armenia had an overall moderately satisfactory outcome, with
            the performance of the Bank being deemed satisfactory, while
            the borrower's performance was felt to be moderately
            satisfactory. Of the six project development objective
            indicators, five were achieved, while one was not achieved.
            Of the five intermediate outcome indicators, one exceeded
            the target by a large margin, two were achieved, one was
            partially achieved, and one was not achieved. Significant
            lessons learned during project implementation include: 1)
            operations seeking to modernize organizational practices
            even through apparently low key technical investments in ICT
            should expect and explicitly address potential risks,
            resistance, and mitigating measures; 2) change management
            efforts might be more effective if the accountability
            systems are introduced at project inception; 3) selective
            use of independent project monitoring mechanisms, especially
            of an expert character, can bring credible feedback on
            project performance; and 4) project team continuity is valuable.

repnme.cdata!: Armenia - Second Judicial Reform Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Second Judicial
            Reform Project for Armenia is to provide Armenia's
            judiciary with the administration, facilities and expanded
            capacity necessary to improve the efficiency, reliability
            and transparency of judicial operations and services; and
            continue to improve public awareness of judicial services
            and access to legal and judicial information. The closing
            date for the project will be extended from December 31, 2012
            until June 30, 2013. The implementation of the project has
            been progressing well, with high rates of disbursement and
            made publicly acknowledged improvements in the area of
            judicial transparency and court administration. The
            extension is necessary to complete the Credit funded
            construction of Kapan courthouse and Japanese Policy and
            Human Resources Development (PHRD) co-financing grant funded
            technical assistance related to capacity building activities
            on judicial training, judicial budgeting and statistics. The
            Recipient has an action plan to complete the activities
            before the extended closing date. The audited financial
            statements on the project have been received by due date.
            This will be the first extension of the project.

display_title.display_title:
Armenia - Second Judicial Reform
            Project : restructuring : Main report
